video.title: Alexa Development 101 - Full Amazon Echo tutorial course in one video!
video.description:
*** This video has been UPDATED: https://youtu.be/QkbXjknPoXc ***

If you want to start building skills for Amazon Alexa and you're new to programming - this course was created especially for you! By the end of this course, you'll be able to create custom skills for Amazon Alexa - from scratch - even if you've never written a line of code in your life.

⭐ Course Outline (all in this video) ⭐

⌨  00:00:02 - Lesson 01: Welcome & Course Introduction
⌨  00:01:27 - Lesson 02: A Technical Overview of Alexa
⌨  00:06:11 - Lesson 03: Skills Setup in the Developer Portal
⌨  00:12:45 - Lesson 04: Understanding Intents and Slots
⌨  00:16:16 - Lesson 05: Creating Skill Services
⌨  00:24:09 - Lesson 06: Understanding Skill Code
⌨  00:32:06 - Lesson 07: Skill Testing
⌨  00:37:33 - Lesson 08: Planning and Design
⌨  00:46:55 - Lesson 09: Building a Complete Skill
⌨  00:59:30 - Lesson 10: Skill Certification
⌨  01:06:19 - Lesson 11: Next Steps

💻 GitHub repo: https://github.com/dabblelab/alexa-development-101

🔗 For more Alexa development videos, check out the Dabble Lab channel: https://www.youtube.com/dabblelab

🐦 Creator Steve Tingiris on Twitter: https://twitter.com/tingiris

-
Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.com

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.com

topLevelComment.author: Prince maliyan
topLevelComment.text: sir someone can help me in solving my problem statement......./Supply of doctors is limited in India especially in smaller towns and villages making provision of healthcare difficult to a large number of people. Telemedicine and other solutions in the past have also struggled to scale up due to this problem. Now in the age of digital assistants like Google and Alexa, can we create artificial intelligence based "doctor" that can diagnose everyday acute diseases like common cold, flu, etc, based on simple questions?

topLevelComment.author: B S-H
topLevelComment.text: New to programming -- is that all I'd have to be new to? Will I, as a non-techie but an experienced user, be able to understand the jargon?  (For instance, I learned the other day that flashing rather than involving men's genitalia and a trenchcoat is actually installing software. Who knew?) What I really want is an Alexa app to control my Roku device. I'm tired of having to wrestle all 5,000 remotes from my husband.  Doable or fantasy?

Thanks,

I have tried different browsers and different region selections without success. Please can you advise what I am doing wrong.

topLevelComment.author: Ankit Singh
topLevelComment.text:
Thanks For the Video :-) 
I am following the steps mentioned, but for the request which you are sending (as per the video Time : 23:30) is : 

  "request": {
    "type": "LaunchRequest",
    "requestId": "EdwRequestId.315a5f21-b0c9-4ee7-a9b6-9bc97df5cb52",
  ...
...
..
    },

-------------------
But in my case its different : 

  "request": {
    "type": "IntentRequest",
    "requestId": "EdwRequestId.315a5f21-b0c9-4ee7-a9b6-9bc97df5cb52",
    "intent": {
      "name": "GeneralGreeting",
      "slots": {}
    },


Instead of Launch Request its requesting for IntentRequest.
After debug I am able to see the error logs as :

{
  "errorMessage": "No 'Unhandled' function defined for event: Unhandled",
  "errorType": "Error",
  "stackTrace": [
    "AlexaRequestEmitter.EmitEvent (/var/task/node_modules/alexa-sdk/lib/alexa.js:212:15)",
    "AlexaRequestEmitter.ValidateRequest (/var/task/node_modules/alexa-sdk/lib/alexa.js:172:23)",
    "HandleLambdaEvent.i18n.use.init (/var/task/node_modules/alexa-sdk/lib/alexa.js:114:29)",
    "/var/task/node_modules/i18next/dist/commonjs/i18next.js:190:9",
    "done (/var/task/node_modules/i18next/dist/commonjs/i18next.js:281:21)",
    "/var/task/node_modules/i18next/dist/commonjs/i18next.js:302:7",
    "I18n.loadResources (/var/task/node_modules/i18next/dist/commonjs/i18next.js:238:7)",
    "I18n.changeLanguage (/var/task/node_modules/i18next/dist/commonjs/i18next.js:301:10)",
    "load (/var/task/node_modules/i18next/dist/commonjs/i18next.js:186:14)",
    "I18n.init (/var/task/node_modules/i18next/dist/commonjs/i18next.js:195:7)"
  ]
}

Could you please ! let me know in-case I missed some steps.

topLevelComment.text: great videos!!  I wanted to access the apps I've built from a different country. My app is hosted on the US N Virginia region, and I wanted to access the app in India. I added an additional language English (india). But while testing alexa wont access these apps. can you tell me where i might be going wrong?

topLevelComment.author: Taylor Made Harris Wheels
topLevelComment.text: 23:05 anyone get this Error: Invalid ARN for NA region. Please provide a valid ARN in the form 'arn:aws:lambda:us-east-1:000000000000:function:myFunction:myFunctionVersion'

replies.author: Ankit Singh
replies.text:
I got that ! There are 2 thing you might need to select :
1) Select N.Virginia from the region drop-down
2) Select Alexa Skills Kit - for triggering.

Hope so that would help you. :-)

replies.author: Taylor Made Harris Wheels
replies.text: Ankit Singh I didn't will let you know if I do

replies.author: Ankit Singh

topLevelComment.author: Arshad Syed
topLevelComment.text:
The screen at 20:41 is different. Also, the AWS alexa-skill-kit-sdk-factskill blueprint only works in two regions: US East (N. Virginia) and EU (Ireland). Lambda functions in other regions do not show the Alexa Skill Kit trigger. Kinda confusing.

I had to change the region before adding the trigger.

topLevelComment.author: Arshad Syed
topLevelComment.text: Thanks for the comprehensive tutorial. The AWS section to add Lambda function has changed. Also, even through I added the Alexa SDK blueprint, the "Alexa Skills Kit" option was not there when I wanted to add a trigger. What am I doing wrong?

replies.author: Dabble Lab
replies.text: Hi Arshad, Amazon has done a few updates since this video was recorded. Here is a link to another video that will show how to add the trigger in Lambda using the new UI. https://youtu.be/n_hMTi1VKWQ

topLevelComment.author: Bill Blackmon
topLevelComment.text: Thanks for the tutorial! Well done, unfortunately I'm getting stuck when I generate the ARN. When I paste it into the endpoint field I get the following error message: Error: Invalid ARN for NA region. Please provide a valid ARN in the form 'arn:aws:lambda:us-east-1:000000000000:function:myFunction:myFunctionVersion' . The generated ARN is: arn:aws:lambda:us-east-2:415024905434:function:testFunctionName . What is the problem here? I also get a warning when I select the Using blueprint alexa-skill-kit-sdk-factskill. After selecting it for function development I get a warning saying 'This function contains external libraries.' How to proceed?

replies.author: Dabble Lab
replies.text: Hey Bill, I have done a number of videos at http://youtube.com/dabblelab and everything (code anyhow) is done in Node. Here is one video that talks about calling an external API from node https://youtu.be/vsEaGjPPLqM - I hope that helps and thanks again!

replies.author: Bill Blackmon
replies.text: Thanks for the new video. I imagine it's hard for you and your team to work against a moving target like Alexa Developement, so thanks for your hard work. I'm a Java developer trying to find my way through all of this. Any videos on integrating Alexa with Node or Java and REST web services running locally? Thanks again.

replies.author: Ankit Singh
replies.text:
Okay ! can you select the Alexa Skills Kit option from the Trigger options. 
Hope so that would help. (Worked for me.)

replies.author: Bill Blackmon
replies.text: Id' try this tutorial - it's more up to date and everything works. You have to use use the Eastern US Virginia region to generate the URN but I've found that doesn't always work either. Try this: https://learn.amazonfutureengineer.com/alexa/fact-skill/#/

replies.author: Ankit Singh
replies.text: Even I am facing the similar issue ! Did you find out solution for it ?

topLevelComment.author: Liam Bishop
topLevelComment.text: the service response says; the remote endpoint could not be called or the response sent was invalid? please help

replies.text: actually i got it to work trigger with just "hello world" but when i change the utterance of GeneralGreeting to "something" that doesn't work.

replies.author: Samson Zheng
replies.text: same problem. is there any other solution

replies.author: Saurabh Siwa
replies.text: change intent name to GeneralGreeting in the code inline. Mine is at no 112.

topLevelComment.author: Chris Backus
topLevelComment.text: Did the Lambda Management console workflow change?  I am not seeing the same thing as shown.  First is configuration, then triggers.  When I get to the trigger options, Alexa is not one of them.

replies.author: Dabble Lab
replies.text: Hey Chris. Yes, Amazon has made a number of updates. Here is a link to a video that walks through the process using the new UI. https://youtu.be/n_hMTi1VKWQ

topLevelComment.author: venkata bangaru raju potnuru
topLevelComment.text:
Hi ,
I have created one custom skill and i have tested the lambda function and even i tested  in the service simulator also it is working fine bt when im trying to test in the echo dot it is not working , could you please help me out

replies.author: Brian Noonan
replies.text: make sure your alexa is in the same language as the skill( it's default US)

replies.author: Dabble Lab
replies.text: Be sure that the email address you used for your developer account is the same as the one you have associated with your Echo. My first guess is that's the issue but let me know if not.

topLevelComment.author: JSanchez
topLevelComment.text: This is SO MUCH better than the Alexa Developer YT videos.  So much easier to understand and went from very frustrated, to very confident after watching this video.  Thanks much!!

replies.author: opentelemark
replies.text: Seconded!  Peter

replies.author: Dabble Lab
replies.text: You're very welcome and thanks so much for the feedback! Also, I've created a shortened walk-through that covers the most recent updates that you might also be interested in. It's located here https://youtu.be/n_hMTi1VKWQ

topLevelComment.author: sahil arora
topLevelComment.text: Hi , Great Video ,I need your help though could you add price as well in your skill data and then do the same thing with same intent???

replies.author: Dabble Lab
replies.text: Hi Sahil, I'm not exactly sure I understand your question but I believe you're asking if you can collect multiple parameters (slots) in a single intent. If that's what you're asking the answer is yes. Here is another video I did that discusses using slots in a bit more detail. https://youtu.be/_SUeL-HSuIo - I hope that helps!

topLevelComment.author: mydetlef
topLevelComment.text: Is it possible to create a skill which response not on a voice command but on an external event. Like a skill is watching the fever temperature of my child and I get a spoken alarm if the temperature passed over a given limit.

replies.author: Dabble Lab
replies.text: Unfortunately, there is no way at this point to trigger alerts through an Alexa skill from an external source. Hopefully, that will be possible at some point but as of today it's not.

topLevelComment.author: David Connelly
topLevelComment.text: FOLLOW UP:  Just watched from start to finish.  That was ASTONISHINGLY good.  Wow!  I do wonder if you can make Alexa recognize non-human sounds.  Nevertheless, that was outstanding.  THANK YOU!

replies.author: Dabble Lab
replies.text: Hey David, thanks for the great feedback. I'm really glad you found the tutorial valuable!

topLevelComment.author: David Connelly
topLevelComment.text: Quick question before I start (forgive me if this is answered in the video)::  Can you train Alexa to recognise non-human sounds (like a dog barking or a car door closing)?   Many thanks!

replies.author: Jodde Mason
replies.text: I guess you could have an AI on a Raspberry Pi or other SBC that recognizes a dog bark or something and cause it to speak "Alexa, tell [skill] to [do something]."  Using one AI to trigger another.. not unlike what real intelligence does.

replies.author: Dabble Lab
replies.text: I don't think that would be possible at this point. The Alexa service is invoked with the "wake word" Alexa - without that nothing else would be processed. Good question however, maybe a future version :-)

topLevelComment.author: ozNdis Group
topLevelComment.text: Excellent course, Thanks heaps!

replies.author: Dabble Lab
replies.text: Thanks for the feedback and you're vary welcome!

topLevelComment.author: Chris Stakutis
topLevelComment.text: Another simple question...suppose my app is submitted and approved and now I need to update the lambda function.  Can I do that and it updates immediately or do i have to re-submit?

replies.author: Dabble Lab
replies.text: Hey Chris, I've updated Lambdas without re-submitting but that only works if the update doesn't have any effect on the interaction model.

topLevelComment.author: Chris Stakutis
topLevelComment.text: EXCELLENT and COMPLETE tutorial; wish I found this 2 weeks ago.  I have a dumb question...where is there a good and complete document on the SDK?  Like even simple things like :  how does emit() work and what are my options for it?

replies.author: Dabble Lab
replies.text: Thanks for the comment Chris! I'm glad you found the tutorial helpful. For the documentation, I usually reference the docs on Github at https://github.com/alexa/alexa-skills-kit-sdk-for-nodejs and the developer docs here https://developer.amazon.com/docs/ask-overviews/build-skills-with-the-alexa-skills-kit.html - hope that helps and thanks again!

topLevelComment.author: Alejandro Estrada
topLevelComment.text: Great example, Thanks!

replies.author: Dabble Lab
replies.text: Thanks for the comment Alejandro!

topLevelComment.author: Saurabh Chaturvedi
topLevelComment.text: When I type "open hello world", I get "The remote endpoint could not be called, or the response it returned was invalid." Help!

replies.author: Dabble Lab
replies.text: Hi Saurabh, it sounds like an issue with the Lambda function. Here is a quick video that covers how to easily debug the issue. https://youtu.be/V5lFQc0YFNw

replies.author: Dabble Lab
replies.text: Hi Saurabh, here is a short video I did that will show you how to quickly debug the issue. https://youtu.be/V5lFQc0YFNw - let me know if that helps resolve it.

topLevelComment.author: akinhwan. com
topLevelComment.text: Could you include the google doc outline for gathering requirements?

replies.author: Dabble Lab
replies.text: Hi Andrew, here is a link to the Google doc. https://docs.google.com/document/d/1TIbXug92PMfeNo0nDKW_yyGI_Ab78rnYnD3JZkZsBAw/edit?usp=sharing

topLevelComment.text: Thankyou ..so excited to try this :)
